PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		Malaysia
QUALIFICATIONS
B.Sc. Chemical Engineering, concentration in Bioenergy – Michigan State University
CAREER SUMMARY
2017 to date: ExxonMobil Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
2019 to date
Position: Team Lead, Process Monitoring and Analysis (Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) /Alky Team)
Coached and planned global project rollouts for 20 engineers. Collaborated with senior management to evaluate and improve KPI targets and key deliverables.
Investigated 7 HSE issues, identified corrective and preventative measures to ensure safe work environment as Safety Lead. Developed 5 SOPs and work assessment guidelines to prevent losses and ensure team’s success.
Analyzed the feasibility of processing new crude and led the management of change (MOC) to revise the feed properties operating envelope which increased the refinery revenue by $10 mil per year.
Participated in a HAZOP study for a refinery in Australia. Examined 200+ potential scenarios to identify risks and proposed steps to mitigate potential issues and hazards by utilizing PROII/HYSYS and P&ID.
Developed a catalyst utilization tool for FCC to optimize catalyst additions and catalyst additives such as DeSOx, ZSM-5 and CO-Promoter to save OPEX of $2 million per year. Worked with multinational catalyst vendor companies to conduct catalyst selection studies for EM refineries.
2017 –2019
Position: Process Monitoring and Analysis Engineer (Chemical Engineer)
Optimized and benchmarked unit process operations and performance for FCC, Alkylation, Fractionation, Furnace and Coker technologies, to ensure safe and reliable operation, and maximize profitability.
Provided technical consultancy for 8 ExxonMobil's downstream refineries in the US, Canada, Europe, UAE and Australia. Advised clients on operating strategy, achieved reliability and margin capture of $10 Mil/year.
Involved in a $5 million worth FCC Riser project which doubled the unit’s run-length, prevented unplanned shutdown and improved reliability. Provided support for refinery FCC Turnaround and project commissioning.
Utilized JMP, SeeQ Advance Analytics and Excel VBA to analyze process data and build prediction models (multivariate fit, linear and non-linear regression analysis), which led to cumulative benefit of $15 mil.
Solved a long-standing FCC mass and energy balance (HMB) closure issue by utilizing PIMS tool to represent the feed and products properties.
October 2016 – March 2017 Michigan Biotech Institute, East Lansing, Michigan
Position: Research Assistant
Developed ammonia pretreatment process for lignocellulosic biomass to yield 50% more biofuels
Operated chemical reactors and distillation columns to convert biomass into biofuels. Analyzed 40 successful test results.
2016 Petronas Chemicals Group Berhad, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Position: Chemical Engineering Intern
Analyzed and improved the integrated process of producing acetic acid, ammonia, and petrochemical products.
Developed an economic and value chain model to increase the net profit of carbon monoxide and acetic acid production. Presented to senior management and received recognition for Best Intern
COMMENT
Passionate, self-driven Chemical Engineer, eager to learn about Energy, Oil & Gas, Data Analytics, Consultancy, Leadership and Management. 4 years of experience in the oil & gas and energy industry as a process engineer and data analyst.
Awards
Ranked top 5 in ExxonMobil ranking cycle (pool of 100 employees) for 3 consecutive years
7 ExxonMobil Leadership Awards (20 awards per year)
5 ExxonMobil Technical Excellence Awards (50 awards per year)
MSU Dean’s List Award for 8 consecutive semesters
MSU College of Engineering Sara V Larian Memorial Scholarship in 2017 (5 awards per year for 1,000 applicants)
MSU Emerging Student Leader Award in 2016 (5 awards per year for most outstanding student organization President)
Skills
PRO II/ HYSIS
MATLAB
Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
JMP Data Analytics
SeeQ
Tableau
SQL
P&ID and PFD
Kepner-Tregoe Problem Solving & Decision Making
Extra-Curricular Achievements
Founder, President of MSU International Students in Engineering (ISE) October 2015 – March 2017
Founded and directed the organization consisting of 30 members to promote collaboration among engineering organizations. Coached members on resume writing and organized career fairs to build connections with companies. Improved international students’ engagement by 300%.
Advertising Chair of American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE) April 2015 – April 2017
Planned 15 company engagement events to provide members with industrial exposures and job prospects.
Tutored chemical engineering courses for 100 students, improved average grades by 30%.
Orientation Leader & Supervisor of International Student Association July 2015 – August 2016
Led 18 orientation leaders and facilitated them to guide 300 freshmen with the aim to enhance and simplify the adjustment process of new students.
President & Project Director for MSU Malaysian Student Organization August 2013 – May 2015
Led 50 students to organize Malaysian Night, an event to expose MSU students to Malaysian culture with 2,000 attendees, raised $5k funding.
Collaborated with 25 student organizations to hold Global Festival which had 10,000 attendees.
For further information please contact Julie Smith on 01695 570 696 or email Julie.smith@johnston-vere.co.uk
